article_title: Doug Ducey, Governor of Arizona, OKs National Guard Carrying Guns
article_text:
PHOENIX (AP) — Gov. Doug Ducey has authorized Arizona National Guard members to carry firearms while on duty in response to last week's shootings at military facilities in Tennessee.

The governor issued an executive order Wednesday calling for the policy change and a review of security measures at Guardfacilities.

He joined several other governors who authorized Guard members to take up arms to protect recruiting offices and installations.



[READ: 4 Questions About the Army National Guard, Answered by Graphs]

Ducey says his office is committed to ensuring the safety of Guard members.

The move to remove bans on service members carrying guns at recruiting offices comes after a man killed four Marines and wounded a sailor and another Marine on Thursday at a pair of military facilities in Chattanooga, Tennessee.
